member.name: T:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep
member.summary: A patrolling step represents a move with the camera to a predefined position specified by a preset. It includes all the necessary information to move the camera one step. The expected transition time to the preset, for how long it should wait in the specified position and the speed of the pan and tilt as well as the zoom speed.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.Profile
member.summary: The patrolling profile to which the patrolling step belongs.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.Position
member.summary: The index position for the patrolling step in relation too all previous steps of the profile.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.Preset
member.summary: The predefined preset for the camera to move to in this patrolling step.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.WaitTime
member.summary: Specifies for how long the camera should stay in this position until it continues to the next patrolling step.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.ExpectedTransitionTimeToPreset
member.summary: The expected time required for the camera to move the specified preset. This is used when disabling plugins during movement. When the camera moves between presets it is possible to disable plugins such as motion detection and other. This time specifies for how long plugins should be disbled.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.PanSpeed
member.summary: Allow the pan-speed of the camera to defined. This is only possible if IsPanSpeedAvailable is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.TiltSpeed
member.summary: Allow the tilt-speed of the camera to defined. This is only possible if IsTiltSpeedAvailable is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.PatrollingStep.ZoomSpeed
member.summary: Allow the zoom-speed of the camera to defined. This is only possible if IsZoomSpeedAvailable is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TagTime time.
member.value: The date the MarkedData is triggered.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TimeEnd time.
member.value: This is the endtime of the MarkedData.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.FailoverServer.MoveFailoverServer(VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.FailoverServerGroup,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the failover server to the same or another server group at a specific or "system determined" position. All failover server objects in the source server group as well as destination server group will be refreshed due to this function. However, if one of above failover server objects are dirty, an InvalidOperationException will be thrown
member.param: The new parent failover server group under which the failover server is placed
The new position (priority) in the server group for the failover server. The value can [0, number of failover servers in group]. The value -1 means "system decides the position (priority)"
member.exception:
Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred ealier or in dirty state
- or - If any failover servers in the source server group or destination server group is dirty
This expection is thrown in case of communication erros or if an unknown error occurs.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.FailoverServer.MoveFailoverServerToManagementServer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the failover server to the Management Server at a specific or "system determined" position. All failover server objects in the source server group as well as all under the Management Server will be refreshed due to this function. However, if one of above failover server objects are dirty, an InvalidOperationException will be thrown
member.param: The new position (priority) in the server group for the failover server. The value can [0, number of failover servers in group]. The value -1 means "system decides the position (priority)"
member.exception:
Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred ealier or in dirty state
- or - If any failover servers in the source server group or under the Management Server is dirty
This expection is thrown in case of communication erros or if an unknown error occurs.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.RecordingDevice.ChangeRecordingStorage(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the device to another recording storage. This action will refresh the object.
member.param: Id of the that the device is being moved to.
true to allow any existing media data to be moved to the new storage; otherwise, false.
member.returns: object with progress information of the operation.
member.exception: Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred ealier
Thrown in case of server communication issues, Sql server issues, invalid property values etc.
member.remarks:
Moving media data to a new recording storage is potentially a long running operation as the recording server may have to move a lot of data.
Calling this function will therefore make the configuration change and will create a task that is executed by the recording server to actually perform the move operation.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.RecordingDevice.RequestEdgeStorageRetrieval(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.String)

The end time of the interval from where to retrieve edge storage.

member.exception: Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred ealier

The feature is not license on the server

member.remarks: Requesting edge storage retrieval is only supported by servers where is or above.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.AxisTunnelServer
member.summary: The AxisTunnelServer object represents a AxisTunnelServer. The AxisTunnelServer inherits from the HostingServer class that contains the generic hosting server information.
member.remarks: A AxisTunnelServer is a local recorder installed at XPCO. It contains registered AxisOneClick cameras and makes recordings from these cameras. The cameras are typically placed behind a firewall. The AxisTunnelServer is registered at the Axis Dispatch Server

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.ServerGroup.AddNotification(VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.VmoObject)
member.summary:
This method potentially adds a child object to one of this object's child collections This is made by giving a notification to the parent (this) which will trigger a refresh of this parent object itself and its collections including the collection having the child object.
Furthermore all objects having a server group as parent: Public View Group, Private View Group, View Layout group, Failover group and View MUST use the property "ServerGroupPropertyName.ParentServerGroupId" for a specification of their parent group.
member.param: The object (public view group, private view group, view layout group, failover group, view) that shall be added to the parent collection

The server is unable to connect to the remote site
The server is unable to connect to the remote site

member.name: P:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.Site.ConnectionState
member.summary: Get the connection state of the site. When a site is added to the MFA hierachy it start being in AttachPending state. Then a master site will be created with the state Unauthorized on the remote site. When the master site have been created the state changes to WaitRemoteAuthorize. After the master site have been authroized on the remote site both site will change state to Attached

member.summary: Moves archive storage to a new storage path. This action will refresh the object.
member.param: The new path for the archive storage
member.returns: object with progress information of the operation.

Moving an archive storage is potentially a long running operation as the recording server may have to move a lot of data.
Calling this function will therefore make the configuration change and will create a that is executed by the recording server to actually perform the move operation.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.Hardware.MoveToRecordingServer(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the hardware device to another recording server.
member.param: Id of the recording server to move the hardware device to.
Id of the storage to move the hardware device to.
true to ignore if is the recording server from which the hardware is moved is unreachable; otherwise, false. Only set this to true if it is confirmed that the source recording server is not running.
member.exception: The functionality is not supported by the server (see remarks).
Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred ealier
Thrown in case of server communication issues, Sql server issues, invalid property values etc.
member.remarks:
Move hardware to another recording server is only supported by servers where is or above.
Moving a hardware device to a new recording server is potentially a long running operation as the hardware must be properly stopped before moving it.
Calling this function will therefore create a task that first stop the hardware device on the current recording server, then it makes the configuration change and finally updates the current and destination recording servers.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Management.VmoClient.Hardware.HardwarePasswordChange(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the hardware password on the device itself.
member.param: The new password of the hardware device in a pure text format
member.exception: The functionality is not supported by the server (see remarks).
Thrown if the object hasn't been created or if a deleted event have occurred earlier.
Thrown in case of server communication issues, Sql server issues, invalid property values etc.
member.remarks:
Change hardware password is supported only if is or above.
Changing password for hardware device can take some time.
Calling this function will therefore create a task that will try to change the password on the device itself and if successful call the to change the VMS password also.

Changing credentials for hardware device can take some time.
Calling this function will therefore create a task that will try to change the password on the device itself and if successful call the to change the VMS password also.
